title: To those who QQ'd most about Ahri Win-rate to Pick-rate...
body:
Ahri's pick rate, Yes its the highest right now
Ahri's win rate, Although it is a high rate, it is number 6 on mid lane champion win-rates

https://na.op.gg/champion/statistics

She might get picked a lot and may be doing pretty good for herself, but that in no way means that she is broken. If she was broken she would have #1 pick rate WITH #1 win rate. But she doesn't, heck Ziggs bot lane has the highest win-rate for bot laners right now... which shows you that balance in general in League is shit XD

replies.body: I can't tell if this is satire or not. I'm guessing satire?
Shhh.... let them figure that out themselves XD{{sticker:slayer-jinx-wink}}
If a champion has a high pickrate AND winrate that champion is too easy to pick up and is too strong.

"Here is all the reasons why she's broken but then I will say she's not broken. Why? Because her data doesn't reflect her being the most broken possible piece of shit that ever existed since the bread slicer. And of course, only the most broken things ever since the bread slicer can be called broken."

She isn't broken in terms of damage. Her damage is actually not that ridiculous. The reason she is the most picked and has one of the best win rates is because of her ability to play behind against an enemy laner because of her disengage. If you are able to not feed the fuck out of your lane which is what Ahri's kit allows her to do. You can let your team carry. And if you are ahead, then you play like any other mid laner who cannot be punished by ganks because of her mobility.

 Right now, I think Orianna is equally as powerful as Ahri, and actually might be stronger than Ahri. Expect Orianna's pick rate and win rate to go up once Ahri gets hit.

SHH!!!!..... Keep quiet about orianna... only the mains are suppose to know this. KILL THE AHRI.. KILL HER. But in all Seriousness, While Orianna is really safe, she's not really safe on the level that Ahri is, or Anivia. She's pretty vulnerable to divers so if they have a fed hecrim or Zac, expect to see a lot of grey on your screen. with Ahri... not so much. Your ult will probably be wasted every time and you probably won't have much impact other than drawing attention mid, but at least you'll live.

Oh, I do agree. Ahri is a lot safer. Which is why she is the most picked champion. Orianna does not have Ahri's mobility and as you said cannot deal with dives just like any other non-mobility mage. But at the same time, she can clear waves fast enough to the point you cannot push in the wave for a dive. She plays well when behind and plays extremely well ahead. She has a very flexible build path and is probably one of the best control mages. Anivia is also one of those hidden gems that will see a rise in play. She has amazing poke, her wall is a game changer and she can be non-interactive with her lane if she chooses to with her R. I honestly think that Orianna and Ahri are both amazing champions. I don't think they need a nerf, I think Riot needs to work champions up to their level.

I agree with that last point in particular. Every since ghost and rylais got nerfed Viktor took a pretty hard hit, I wanted to be a Viktor/Ori main, but because the second part of his E is relatively unreliable now and it's pretty hard to get the last tick of damage off on his ult, it doesn't seem  worth investing in. You're effectively going to be doing the same damage as a well placed Ori ult but bring none of that utility. I think he could use, not a damage buff, but a little more reliability to damage already in his kit. And at some point hopefully they'll do something with Azir and his awkward spot. Technically for those who've invested 100+ games in him, he's in a decent spot where mains can hard carry games  but for anyone else he's pretty much asking to lose. Hope to see some word on him soon. A long ranged AoE DPS mage is what Azir is meant to be, hopefully they keep the concept but make it more accessible/not broken whenever they do make changes.

Upvoted. Because fuck ahri, literally, and figuratively.
